title: Kac's lemma
summary: In ergodic theory, Kac's lemma, demonstrated by mathematician Mark Kac in 1947,[1] is a lemma stating that in a measure space the orbit of almost all the points contained in a set A {\displaystyle A} of such space, whose measure is μ ( A ) {\displaystyle \mu (A)} , return to A {\displaystyle A} within an average time inversely proportional to μ ( A ) {\displaystyle \mu (A)} .[2]
